title.narrative: ZNCC Women in Enterprise Conference & Awards (WECA) 2018
ZNCC Women in Enterprise Conference & Awards (WECA) 2018

description.narrative: The Zimbabwe National Chamber of Commerce (ZNCC) has applied to Sida for funding of 64 000 SEK to carry out the "Women in Enterprise Conference and Awards (WECA)” in Zimbabwe during the period 2018. The 2018 WECA conference will bring together women owned business and enterprises on issues around sustainability, branding and marketing, and tapping into the regional and international markets.

Zimbabwe National Chamber of Commerce (ZNCC) har ansökt om ett bidrag om 64 000 SEK för att anordna “Women in Enterprise Conference and Awards (WECA) ” i Zimbabwe under perioden 2018. 2018 års WECA konferens kommer att föra samman kvinnliga företagare och entreprenörer för att diskutera frågor kring hållbarhet, varumärken, marknadsföring och den regionala och internationella marknaden.

The Zimbabwe National Chamber of Commerce (ZNCC) has applied to Sida for funding of 64 000 SEK to carry out the "Women in Enterprise Conference and Awards (WECA)” in Zimbabwe during the period 2018. The 2018 WECA conference will bring together women owned business and enterprises on issues around sustainability, branding and marketing, and tapping into the regional and international markets. This is an annual event held by ZNCC and it will bring women entrepreneurs and experts for discussion and acknowledgement on the key role women play in the developing the Zimbabwean economy through the Women in Enterprise Conference and Awards (WECA).

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Embassy has assessed that the 2018 ZNCC WECA conference achieved its intended objectives outlined above. The WECA conference attracted 170 delegates, whilst the award dinner hosted 300 guests. The 2018 conference saw renewed interest by various stakeholders including Government, in ensuring that women owned businesses have the space to engage. Stakeholders included the Ministry of Industry and Commerce, commercial banks, manufacturers, service providers and the academia. Key Strategic Outcomes from the 2018 Conference are: 1. FinancingLimited financing and restricted access to capital has been recurrent hence there is need to support members in pursuit of equity financing.2. Strategic development partnershipsZNCC Women's Desk should support women to seek and set up stronger alliances with collaborates who offer better potential for value chains. Most women owned businesses are excluded from or are ignorant of how to enter this critical cycle.3. CompetitivenessZNCC Women's Desk to support members pursue local, regional and global competitiveness as women in business are urged to enhance their personal and institutional capacity to their standardize products and services.4. Curbing the trade deficitTo support ZNCC Women's Desk in finding innovate ways for exploiting and monetising opportunities of import substitution to leverage foreign currency generation. The Embassy assesses that whilst these outcomes are important for ZNCC to achieve they are also critical in the Embassy achieving its objectives of creating jobs and supporting small to medium enterprises; particularly those owned by women. The Embassy will continue to dialogue with with ZNCC on how it can strategically support the women owned enterprises on a continuous basis.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
